column4: I type sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 start but nothing happens. It just takes me to the next prompt without doing anything
it means all is good -- continue on to the next step
i dunno, whatever it is you need to do after starting apache
It's not starting, is what I'm saying
is apache even installed?? I really wonder
that's not normal, if i were you, i would reinstall apache -- sudo apt-get install --reinstall apache2
I did that too, still no luck
have you tried browsing to http://localhost ?
ok, have a look in your log files -- grep -i apache /var/log/{syslog,debug} | less  -- see what you can make off the failure to start
